aima.core.probability.mdp

Interface Policy<S,A extends Action>

  • Type Parameters:
    S - the state type.
    A - the action type.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LookupPolicy

    public interface Policy<S,A extends Action>
    Artificial Intelligence A Modern Approach (3rd Edition): page 647.

    A solution to a Markov decision process is called a policy. It specifies what the agent should do for any state that the agent might reach. It is traditional to denote a policy by π, and π(s) is the action recommended by the policy π for state s. If the agent has a complete policy, then no matter what the outcome of any action, the agent will always know what to do next.
    Author:
    Ciaran O'Reilly, Ravi Mohan
